name: Apache Ant
description: Build process management with XML.

name: cglib
description: Bytecode generation library.

name: GlassFish
description: Application server and reference implementation for Java EE sponsored by Oracle.

name: Hudson
description: Continuous integration server still in active development.

name: JavaServer Faces
description: Oracle's open-source implementation of the JSF standard, Mojarra.

name: JavaServer Pages
description: Common templating for websites with custom tag libraries.

name: Dozer
description: Mapper that copies data from one object to another, using annotations, API or XML configuration.

name: MapStruct
description: Code generator which simplifies mappings between different bean types, based on a convention over configuration approach.

name: ModelMapper
description: ModelMapper is an intelligent object mapping library that automatically maps objects to each other.

name: Orika
description: Orika is a Java Bean mapping framework that recursively copies (among other capabilities) data from one object to another.

name: Selma
description: Stupid Simple Statically Linked Mapper. Selma is an Annotation Processor Based bean mapper.

name: Apache Maven
description: Declarative build and dependency management which favors convention over configuration. It might be preferable to Apache Ant which uses a rather procedural approach and can be difficult to maintain.

name: Bazel
description: Build tool from Google that builds code quickly and reliably.

name: Gradle
description: Incremental builds which are programmed via Groovy instead of declaring XML. Works well with Maven's dependency management.

name: ASM
description: All purpose, low level, bytecode manipulation and analysis.

name: Byte Buddy
description: Further simplifies bytecode generation with a fluent API.

name: Byteman
description: Manipulate bytecode at runtime via DSL (rules) mainly for testing/troubleshooting.

name: Javassist
description: Tries to simplify the editing of bytecode.

name: Apache Aurora
description: Apache Aurora is a Mesos framework for long-running services and cron jobs.

name: Singularity
description: Singularity is a Mesos framework that makes deployment and operations easy. It supports web services, background workers, scheduled jobs, and one-off tasks.

name: Checkstyle
description: Static analysis of coding conventions and standards.

name: Error Prone
description: Catches common programming mistakes as compile-time errors.

name: FindBugs
description: Static analysis of bytecode to find potential bugs.

name: jQAssistant
description: Static code analysis with Neo4J-based query language.

name: PMD
description: Source code analysis for finding bad coding practices.

name: SonarQube
description: Integrates other analysis components via plugins and provides an overview of the metrics over time.

name: JaCoCo
description: Framework that enables collection of code coverage metrics, using both offline and runtime bytecode instrumentation; prominently used by EclEmma, the Eclipse code-coverage plugin.

name: Clover
description: Proprietary code coverage tool by Atlassian that relies on source-code instrumentation, instead of bytecode instrumentation.

name: Cobertura
description: Relies on offline (or static) bytecode instrumentation and class loading to collect code coverage metrics; GPLv2 licensed.

name: JCov
description: Code coverage tool used in the OpenJDK project's development toolchain.

name: ANTLR
description: Complex full-featured framework for top-down parsing.

name: JavaCC
description: More specific and slightly easier to learn. Has syntactic lookahead.

name: config
description: Configuration library for JVM languages.

name: owner
description: Reduces boilerplate of properties.

name: Choco
description: Off-the-shelf constraint satisfaction problem solver, which uses constraint programming techniques.

name: JaCoP
description: Includes an interface for the FlatZinc language, enabling it to execute MiniZinc models.

name: OptaPlanner
description: Business planning and resource scheduling optimization solver.

name: Sat4J
description: State-of-the-art SAT solver for boolean and optimization problems.

name: Bamboo
description: Atlassian's solution with good integration of their other products. You can either apply for an open-source license or buy it.

name: CircleCI
description: Hosted service with a free trial.

name: Codeship
description: Hosted services with a limited free plan.

name: fabric8
description: Integration platform for containers.

name: Go
description: ThoughtWork's open-source solution.

name: Jenkins
description: Provides server-based deployment services.

name: TeamCity
description: JetBrain's CI solution with a free version.

name: Travis
description: Hosted service often used for open-source projects.

name: opencsv
description: Simple CSV parser with a commercial-friendly license.

name: uniVocity-parsers
description: One of the fastest and most feature-complete CSV. Also comes with parsers for TSV and fixed width records.

name: [Apache Hive] (https://hive.apache.org/)
description: Data warehouse infrastructure built on top of Hadoop.

name: Apache Phoenix
description: High performance relational database layer over HBase for low latency applications.

name: Crate
description: Distributed data store that implements data synchronization, sharding, scaling, and replication. In addition, it provides a SQL-based syntax to execute queries across a cluster.

name: FlexyPool
description: Brings metrics and failover strategies to the most common connection pooling solutions.

name: Flyway
description: Simple database migration tool.

name: H2
description: Small SQL Database notable for its in-memory functionality.

name: HikariCP
description: High performance JDBC connection pool.

name: JDBI
description: Convenient abstraction of JDBC.

name: Jedis
description: A small client for interaction with redis, with methods for commands.

name: jOOQ
description: Generates typesafe code based on SQL schema.

name: Liquibase
description: Database-independent library for tracking, managing and applying database schema changes.

name: MapDB
description: Embedded database engine that provides concurrent collections backed on disk or in off-heap memory.

name: Presto
description: Distributed SQL query engine for big data.

name: Querydsl
description: Typesafe unified queries.

name: Redisson
description: Allows for distributed and scalable data structures on top of a Redis server.

name: Apache Avro
description: Data interchange format featuring among others: dynamic typing, untagged data, absence of manually assigned IDs.

name: Apache Orc
description: Fast and efficient columnar storage format for hadoop based workloads.

name: Apache Parquet
description: Columnar storage format based on assembly algorithms from the Dremel paper by Google.

name: Apache Thrift
description: Data interchange format that originated at Facebook.

name: Persistent Collection
description: Persistent and immutable analogue of the Java Collections Framework.

name: Protobuf
description: Google's data interchange format.

name: SBE
description: Simple Binary Encoding, one of the fastest message formats around.

name: Wire
description: Clean, lightweight protocol buffers.

name: Joda-Time
description: De facto standard date/time-library before Java 8.

name: ThreeTenBP
description: Port of JSR 310 (java.time package) by the author of Joda-Time.

name: Time4J
description: Advanced date and time library.

name: Apache DeltaSpike
description: CDI extension framework.

name: Dagger2
description: Compile-time injection framework without reflection.

name: Guice
description: Lightweight but powerful framework that completes Dagger.

name: HK2
description: Light-weight and dynamic dependency injection framework.

name: ADT4J
description: JSR-269 code generator for algebraic data types.

name: AspectJ
description: Seamless aspect-oriented programming extension.

name: Auto
description: Collection of source code generators.

name: DCEVM
description: Modification of the JVM that allows unlimited redefinition of loaded classes at runtime.

name: HotswapAgent
description: Unlimited runtime class and resource redefinition.

name: Immutables
description: Scala-like case classes.

name: JHipster
description: Yeoman source code generator to create applications based on Spring Boot and AngularJS.

name: JRebel
description: Commercial software that instantly reloads code and configuration changes without redeploys.

name: Lombok
description: Code-generator which aims to reduce the verbosity.

name: Spring Loaded
description: Class reloading agent.

name: vert.x
description: Polyglot event-driven application framework.

name: Akka
description: Toolkit and runtime for building concurrent, distributed, and fault tolerant event-driven applications.

name: Apache Storm
description: Realtime computation system.

name: Apache ZooKeeper
description: Coordination service with distributed configuration, synchronization, and naming registry for large distributed systems.

name: Axon Framework
description: Framework for creating CQRS applications.

name: Hazelcast
description: Highly scalable in-memory datagrid.

name: Hystrix
description: Provides latency and fault tolerance.

name: JGroups
description: Toolkit for reliable messaging and creating clusters.

name: Orbit
description: Virtual Actors, adding another level of abstraction to traditional actors.

name: Quasar
description: Lightweight threads and actors for the JVM.

name: Apache Cassandra
description: Column-oriented and providing high availability with no single point of failure.

name: Apache HBase
description: Hadoop database for big data.

name: Druid
description: Real-time and historical OLAP data store that excel at aggregation and approximation queries.

name: Infinispan
description: Highly concurrent key/value datastore used for caching.

name: OpenTSDB
description: Scalable and distributed time series database written on top of Apache HBase.

name: Bintray
description: Version control for binaries which handles the publishing. Can also be used with Maven or Gradle and has a free plan for open-source software or several business plans.

name: Capsule
description: Simple and powerful packaging and deployment. A fat JAR on steroids or a "Docker for Java" that supports JVM-optimized containers.

name: Central Repository
description: Largest binary component repository available as a free service to the open-source community. Default used by Apache Maven and available in all other build tools.

name: IzPack
description: Setup authoring tool for cross-platform deployments.

name: JitPack
description: Easy to use package repository for GitHub. Builds Maven/Gradle projects on demand and publishes ready-to-use packages.

name: Launch4j
description: Wraps JARs in lightweight and native Windows executables.

name: Nexus
description: Binary management with proxy and caching capabilities.

name: packr
description: Packs JARs, assets and the JVM for native distribution on Windows, Linux and Mac OS X.

name: Apache POI
description: Supports OOXML (XLSX, DOCX, PPTX) as well as OLE2 (XLS, DOC or PPT).

name: documents4j
description: API for document format conversion using third-party converters such as MS Word.

name: jOpenDocument
description: Processes the OpenDocument format.

name: CATG
description: Concolic unit testing engine. Automatically generates unit tests using formal methods.

name: Checker Framework
description: Pluggable type systems. Includes nullness types, physical units, immutability types and more.

name: Daikon
description: Daikon detects likely program invariants and can generate JML specs based on those invariats.

name: Java Modeling Language (JML)
description: Behavioral interface specification language that can be used to specify the behavior of code modules. It combines the design by contract approach of Eiffel and the model-based specification approach of the Larch family of interface specification languages, with some elements of the refinement calculus. Used by several other verification tools.

name: Java Path Finder (JPF)
description: JVM formal verification tool containing a model checker and more. Created by NASA.

name: jCUTE
description: Concolic unit testing engine that automatically generates unit tests. Concolic execution combines randomized concrete execution with symbolic execution and automatic constraint solving.

name: JMLOK 2.0
description: Detects nonconformances between code and JML specification through the feedback-directed random tests generation, and suggests a likely cause for each nonconformance detected.

name: KeY
description: The KeY System is a formal software development tool that aims to integrate design, implementation, formal specification, and formal verification of object-oriented software as seamlessly as possible. Uses JML for specification and symbolic execution for verification.

name: OpenJML
description: Translates JML specifications into SMT-LIB format and passes the proof problems implied by the program to backend solvers.

name: Cyclops
description: Monad and stream utilities, comprehensions, pattern matching, trampolines and much more.

name: derive4j
description: Java 8 annotation processor and framework for deriving algebraic data types constructors, pattern-matching, morphisms.

name: Fugue
description: Functional extensions to Guava.

name: Functional Java
description: Implements numerous basic and advanced programming abstractions that assist composition-oriented development.

name: Javaslang
description: Functional component library that provides persistent data types and functional control structures.

name: jOOλ
description: Extension to Java 8 which aims to fix gaps in lambda, providing numerous missing types and a rich set of sequential Stream API additions.

name: jMonkeyEngine
description: Game engine for modern 3D development.

name: libGDX
description: All-round cross-platform, high-level framework.

name: LWJGL
description: Robust framework that abstracts libraries like OpenGL/CL/AL.

name: JavaFX
description: The successor of Swing.

name: Scene Builder
description: Visual layout tool for JavaFX applications.

name: SWT
description: The Standard Widget Toolkit (SWT) is a graphical widget toolkit for use with the Java platform.

name: Agrona
description: Data structures and utility methods that are common in high-performance applications.

name: Disruptor
description: Inter-thread messaging library.

name: fastutil
description: Fast and compact type-specific collections.

name: GS Collections
description: Collection framework inspired by Smalltalk.

name: HPPC
description: Primitive collections.

name: Javolution
description: Library for real-time and embedded systems.

name: JCTools
description: Concurrency tools currently missing from the JDK.

name: Koloboke
description: Hash sets and hash maps.

name: Trove
description: Primitive collections.

name: Eclipse
description: Established, open-souce project with support for lots of plugins and languages.

name: IntelliJ IDEA
description: Supports a lot of JVM languages and provides good options for Android development. The commercial edition targets the enterprise sector.

name: NetBeans
description: Provides integration for several Java SE and EE features from database access to HTML5.

name: Imgscalr
description: Simple and efficient hardware-accelerated image-scaling library implemented in pure Java 2D.

name: Picasso
description: Image downloading and caching library for Android.

name: Thumbnailator
description: Thumbnailator is a high-quality thumbnail generation library for Java.

name: ZXing
description: Multi-format 1D/2D barcode image processing library.

name: Genson
description: Powerful and easy to use Java to JSON conversion library.

name: Gson
description: Serializes objects to JSON and vice versa. Good performance with on-the-fly usage.

name: Jackson
description: Similar to GSON but has performance gains if you need to instantiate the library more often.

name: LoganSquare
description: JSON parsing and serializing library based on Jackson's streaming API. Outpeforms GSON & Jackson's library.

name: JDK 9
description: Early access releases of JDK 9.

name: OpenJDK
description: Open-source implementation.

name: Apache Log4j 2
description: Complete rewrite with a powerful plugin and configuration architecture.

name: graylog
description: Open-source aggregator suited for extended role and permission management.

name: kibana
description: Analyzes and visualizes log files. Some features require payment.

name: Logback
description: Robust logging library with interesting configuration options via Groovy.

name: logstash
description: Tool for managing log files.

name: Metrics
description: Expose metrics via JMX or HTTP and can send them to a database.

name: SLF4J
description: Abstraction layer which is to be used with an implementation.

name: Apache Flink
description: Fast and reliable large-scale data processing engine.

name: Apache Hadoop
description: Storage and large-scale processing of data-sets on clusters of commodity hardware.

name: Apache Mahout
description: Scalable algorithms focused on collaborative filtering, clustering and classification.

name: Apache Spark
description: Data analytics cluster computing framework.

name: DeepDive
description: Creates structured information from unstructured data and integrates it into an existing database.

name: Deeplearning4j
description: Distributed and multi-threaded deep learning library.

name: H2O
description: Analytics engine for statistics over big data.

name: JSAT
description: Algorithms for pre-processing, classification, regression, and clustering with support for multi-threaded execution.

name: Weka
description: Collection of algorithms for data mining tasks ranging from pre-processing to visualization.

name: Aeron
description: Efficient reliable unicast and multicast message transport.

name: Apache ActiveMQ
description: Message broker that implements JMS and converts synchronous to asynchronous communication.

name: Apache Camel
description: Glues together different transport APIs via Enterprise Integration Patterns.

name: Apache Kafka
description: High-throughput distributed messaging system.

name: Hermes
description: Fast and reliable message broker built on top of Kafka.

name: JBoss HornetQ
description: Clear, concise, modular and made to be embedded.

name: JeroMQ
description: Implementation of ZeroMQ.

name: Smack
description: Cross-platform XMPP client library.

name: Design Patterns
description: Implementation and explanation of the most common design patterns.

name: Jimfs
description: In-memory file system.

name: Lanterna
description: Easy console text GUI library similar to curses.

name: LightAdmin
description: Pluggable CRUD UI library for rapid application development.

name: Modern Java
description: A Guide to Java 8 - Popular Java 8 guide.

name: OpenRefine
description: Tool for working with messy data: cleaning, transforming, extending it with web services and linking it to databases.

name: RoboVM
description: Commercial framework with a free trial to write native iOS apps.

name: AppDynamics
description: Commercial performance monitor.

name: JavaMelody
description: Performance monitoring and profiling.

name: jmxtrans
description: Tool to connect to multiple JVMs and to query them for their attributes via JMX. Its query language is based on JSON, which allows non-Java programmers to access the JVMs attributes. Likewise, this tool supports different output writes, including Graphite, Ganglia, StatsD, among others.

name: Kamon
description: Tool for monitoring applications running on the JVM.

name: New Relic
description: Commercial performance monitor.

name: SPM
description: Commercial performance monitor with distributing transaction tracing for JVM apps.

name: Takipi
description: Commercial in-production error monitoring and debugging.

name: JNA
description: Work with native libraries without writing JNI. Also provides interfaces to common system libraries.

name: JNR
description: Work with native libraries without writing JNI. Also provides interfaces to common system libraries. Same goals as JNA, but faster, and serves as the basis for the upcoming Project Panama.

name: Apache OpenNLP
description: Toolkit for common tasks like tokenization.

name: CoreNLP
description: Stanford's CoreNLP provides a set of fundamental tools for tasks like tagging, named entity recognition, sentiment analysis and many more.

name: LingPipe
description: Toolkit for a variety of tasks ranging from POS tagging to sentiment analysis.

name: Mallet
description: Statistical natural language processing, document classification, clustering, topic modeling and more.

name: Async Http Client
description: Asynchronous HTTP and WebSocket client library.

name: Grizzly
description: NIO framework. Used as a network layer in Glassfish.

name: Netty
description: Framework for building high performance network applications.

name: OkHttp
description: HTTP+SPDY client.

name: Undertow
description: Web server providing both blocking and non-blocking API’s based on NIO. Used as a network layer in WildFly.

name: Ebean
description: Provides simple and fast data access.

name: EclipseLink
description: Supports a number of persistence standards: JPA, JAXB, JCA and SDO.

name: Hibernate
description: Robust and widely used with an active community.

name: MyBatis
description: Couples objects with stored procedures or SQL statements.

name: OrmLite
description: Lightweight package avoiding the complexity and overhead of other ORM products.

name: Apache FOP
description: Creates PDF from XSL-FO.

name: Apache PDFBox
description: Toolbox for creating and manipulating PDF.

name: DynamicReports
description: Simplifies JasperReports.

name: flyingsaucer
description: XML/XHTML and CSS 2.1 renderer.

name: iText
description: Creates PDF files programmatically but requires a license for commercial purposes.

name: JasperReports
description: Complex reporting engine.

name: jHiccup
description: Logs and records platform JVM stalls.

name: JMH
description: Microbenchmarking tool for the JVM.

name: JProfiler
description: Commercial profiler.

name: LatencyUtils
description: Utilities for latency measurement and reporting.

name: VisualVM
description: Visual interface for detailed information about running applications.

name: YourKit Java Profiler
description: Commercial profiler.

name: Reactive Streams
description: Provide a standard for asynchronous stream processing with non-blocking backpressure.

name: Reactor
description: Library for building reactive fast-data applications.

name: RxJava
description: Library for composing asynchronous and event-based programs using observable sequences from the JVM.

name: Dropwizard
description: Opinionated framework for setting up modern web applications with Jetty, Jackson, Jersey and Metrics.

name: Feign
description: HTTP client binder inspired by Retrofit, JAXRS-2.0, and WebSocket.

name: Jersey
description: JAX-RS reference implementation.

name: RESTEasy
description: Fully certified and portable implementation of the JAX-RS specification.

name: RestExpress
description: Thin wrapper on the JBOSS Netty HTTP stack to provide scaling and performance.

name: RestX
description: Framework based on annotation processing and compile-time source generation.

name: Retrofit
description: Type-safe REST client.

name: Spark
description: Sinatra inspired framework.

name: Swagger
description: Swagger is a specification and complete framework implementation for describing, producing, consuming, and visualizing RESTful web services.

name: DataMelt
description: Environment for scientific computation, data analysis and data visualization.

name: JGraphT
description: Graph library that provides mathematical graph-theory objects and algorithms.

name: JScience
description: Provides a set of classes to work with scientific measurements and units.

name: Apache Solr
description: Enterprise search engine optimized for high volume traffic.

name: Elasticsearch
description: Distributed, multitenant-capable full-text search engine with a RESTful web interface and schema-free JSON documents.

name: Apache Shiro
description: Performs authentication, authorization, cryptography and session management.

name: Bouncy Castle
description: All-purpose cryptographic library. JCA provider, wide range of functions from basic helpers to PGP/SMIME operations.

name: Cryptomator
description: Multiplatform transparent client-side encryption of files in the cloud.

name: Google Keyczar
description: Easy to use, yet safe encryption framework with key versioning.

name: Keycloak

name: PicketLink
description: Umbrella project for security and identity management.

name: FST

name: MessagePack

name: Moco
description: Concise web services for stubs and mocks, Duke's Choice Award 2013.

name: Selenide

description: Portable software testing framework for web applications.

name: Spock

name: Truth
description: Google's assertion and proposition framework.

name: WireMock
description: Stubbs and mocks web services.
